meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'langue', meaning a particular language or dialect.
meanings.sent1: Many different langues are spoken in our diverse community.
meanings.sent2: She studied various langues to become a polyglot.
meanings.sent3: The langues at the international festival created a beautiful tapestry of sounds.
meanings.sent4: His ability to switch between different langues was like a linguistic dance.
meanings.sent5: The langues of the world are like colorful threads weaving through humanity.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'langue', meaning the tongue as an organ of speech.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined her langues for any signs of infection.
meanings.sent2: Tasting food requires the use of both langues.
meanings.sent3: His langues were tied when he tried to speak in front of the large audience.
meanings.sent4: The words got stuck on his langues like stubborn glue.
meanings.sent5: The cat's rough langues licked the spilled milk off the floor.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'langue', meaning a particular style or manner of speaking or writing.
meanings.sent1: Her poetic langues captivated the audience during the recital.
meanings.sent2: The author's unique langues set her novels apart from the rest.
meanings.sent3: The politician's flowery langues amused the listeners at the debate.
meanings.sent4: His persuasive langues were like a magic spell on the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's clear langues made complex concepts easy to understand.
